trans-unit.source: Configuring the repos
trans-unit.target: Configuring the repos

trans-unit.source: Content teams need to so some configuration in their repos after creation.
trans-unit.target: Content teams need to so some configuration in their repos after creation.

trans-unit.source: 1. Initial repo configuration
trans-unit.target: 1. Initial repo configuration

trans-unit.source: The following steps assume you are just creating one docset.
trans-unit.target: The following steps assume you are just creating one docset.

trans-unit.source: At the end of the section there are some examples of repo structure if you are creating multiple docsets
trans-unit.target: At the end of the section there are some examples of repo structure if you are creating multiple docsets

trans-unit.source: At the root of the repo, create a .gitignore file.
trans-unit.target: At the root of the repo, create a .gitignore file.

trans-unit.source: Edit it and add the following.
trans-unit.target: Edit it and add the following.

trans-unit.source: This will make that the temporary build folders generated when running local builds don't get pushed into the repo:
trans-unit.target: This will make that the temporary build folders generated when running local builds don't get pushed into the repo:

trans-unit.source: Create at least one folder underneath your repo.
trans-unit.target: Create at least one folder underneath your repo.

trans-unit.source: That would be your docset.
trans-unit.target: That would be your docset.

trans-unit.source: Create a TOC.md inside your docset folder.
trans-unit.target: Create a TOC.md inside your docset folder.

trans-unit.source: Create a live branch.
trans-unit.target: Create a live branch.

trans-unit.source: Open Publishing provision is made out of the "live" branch.
trans-unit.target: Open Publishing provision is made out of the "live" branch.

trans-unit.source: So once you have created the repos, you need to create a live brunch so it can be provisioned.
trans-unit.target: So once you have created the repos, you need to create a live brunch so it can be provisioned.

trans-unit.source: 1.1 Examples of repo structure
trans-unit.target: 1.1 Examples of repo structure

trans-unit.source: The following is a repo structure with one docset.
trans-unit.target: The following is a repo structure with one docset.

trans-unit.source: The following is a repo structure with multiple docsets and independent TOCs.
trans-unit.target: The following is a repo structure with multiple docsets and independent TOCs.

trans-unit.source: The following is a repo structure with multiple docsets and a single TOC.
trans-unit.target: The following is a repo structure with multiple docsets and a single TOC.

trans-unit.source: 2. Branches
trans-unit.target: 2. Branches

trans-unit.source: In open publishing, we use GIT branches to maintain different copies of the same content.
trans-unit.target: In open publishing, we use GIT branches to maintain different copies of the same content.

trans-unit.source: Same topic in different branches will be published to different urls of rendering sites.
trans-unit.target: Same topic in different branches will be published to different urls of rendering sites.

trans-unit.source: This could be used in several scenarios:
trans-unit.target: This could be used in several scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Stage/promote.
trans-unit.target: Stage/promote.

trans-unit.source: User can use one branch as staging branch and merge it to a live branch as a promote operation.
trans-unit.target: User can use one branch as staging branch and merge it to a live branch as a promote operation.

trans-unit.source: Private working branch.
trans-unit.target: Private working branch.

trans-unit.source: User can create his own branch to save files that is still under writing, and merge it to common branch when it's ready.
trans-unit.target: User can create his own branch to save files that is still under writing, and merge it to common branch when it's ready.

trans-unit.source: Files in private branch can still be validated/previewed by open publishing.
trans-unit.target: Files in private branch can still be validated/previewed by open publishing.

trans-unit.source: 2.1 Live Branch
trans-unit.target: 2.1 Live Branch

trans-unit.source: Among all branches, there should be only one branch that is exposed to external users, and other staging/working branches are only used by writers for internal testing.
trans-unit.target: Among all branches, there should be only one branch that is exposed to external users, and other staging/working branches are only used by writers for internal testing.

trans-unit.source: This branch is called "Live" branch.
trans-unit.target: This branch is called "Live" branch.

trans-unit.source: Live branch can be identified by a special branch name.
trans-unit.target: Live branch can be identified by a special branch name.

trans-unit.source: Content in live branch will be published to the live site.
trans-unit.target: Content in live branch will be published to the live site.

trans-unit.source: Content in other branches will still be published, but only to stage or sandbox.
trans-unit.target: Content in other branches will still be published, but only to stage or sandbox.

trans-unit.source: 3. Dogfooding new features using Branches
trans-unit.target: 3. Dogfooding new features using Branches

trans-unit.source: It'll be a common case that user wants to try new features (like a new markdown extension) in his working branch while keep live branch using stable features.
trans-unit.target: It'll be a common case that user wants to try new features (like a new markdown extension) in his working branch while keep live branch using stable features.

trans-unit.source: We're going to support this by allowing the user to specify the build toolset they want to use (in GIT repo).
trans-unit.target: We're going to support this by allowing the user to specify the build toolset they want to use (in GIT repo).

trans-unit.source: We'll release multiple versions of the build tool (specified in packages.config) and let the user choose which one they want to use.
trans-unit.target: We'll release multiple versions of the build tool (specified in packages.config) and let the user choose which one they want to use.

trans-unit.source: After they test the feature in working branch, they can merge the content to live branch then live branch will also upgrade to use the new build tool.
trans-unit.target: After they test the feature in working branch, they can merge the content to live branch then live branch will also upgrade to use the new build tool.

trans-unit.source: 4. Next steps
trans-unit.target: 4. Next steps

trans-unit.source: The next step is to <linkText>provision the repo</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to <linkText>provision the repo</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: VSC will do that for you.
trans-unit.target: VSC will do that for you.

trans-unit.source: Please make sure that:
trans-unit.target: Please make sure that:

trans-unit.source: Please send Xiaokai He and Sandra Aldana the following information:
trans-unit.target: Please send Xiaokai He and Sandra Aldana the following information:

trans-unit.source: Repo URLs
trans-unit.target: Repo URLs

trans-unit.source: Publishing end-point: MSDN, TechNet, VS.com, other.
trans-unit.target: Publishing end-point: MSDN, TechNet, VS.com, other.

trans-unit.source: If other, we need the canonical URL you would like to have for your site.
trans-unit.target: If other, we need the canonical URL you would like to have for your site.

trans-unit.source: Base URL for your content.
trans-unit.target: Base URL for your content.

trans-unit.source: This can be the docset name or a different one.
trans-unit.target: This can be the docset name or a different one.

trans-unit.source: This will be appended to the end-point URL.
trans-unit.target: This will be appended to the end-point URL.

trans-unit.source: In our case, it is "openpublishing/docs", so the URL is http://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs.
trans-unit.target: In our case, it is "openpublishing/docs", so the URL is http://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs.
